intro: Pseudognaphalium selleanum, commonly known as the Hawaiian blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Pseudognaphalium selleanum is known for its resilience to salt spray and wind, making it well adapted to its native habitat.
